posts.post_content:
Yes, this guy suffers from the same problem as [howling mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=howling mine): your opponents will draw first.  
  
That asides, he's huge for his mana cost. A 6/5 for 5 in black is way above the curve. On top of that, he's doing 2 damage per turn to your opponents. He's also quite resilient to removal:  
1) He's black. Most black removal will not work on him.  
2) He has 5 toughness. He's out of the regular burn range.  
  
This leaves the more expensive red removal([fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fireball ) and its ilk) and white removal.  
  
Without a doubt he's amazing in a deck that just wants to kill its opponent. Drawing 3 cards per turn will usually give you enough threats to play. On its own he can stop lots of creatures, and with some support(like [Dauthi Embrace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dauthi Embrace)) he can quickly kill players.  
  
He's also a demon, and demons require some kind of sacrifice. His price is heavy, giving your opponent a 2 for 1 situation. Still, it's worth it.
posts.html:
Yes, this guy suffers from the same problem as howling mine: your opponents will draw first.

That asides, he's huge for his mana cost. A 6/5 for 5 in black is way above the curve. On top of that, he's doing 2 damage per turn to your opponents. He's also quite resilient to removal:
1) He's black. Most black removal will not work on him.
2) He has 5 toughness. He's out of the regular burn range.

This leaves the more expensive red removal(fireball and its ilk) and white removal.

Without a doubt he's amazing in a deck that just wants to kill its opponent. Drawing 3 cards per turn will usually give you enough threats to play. On its own he can stop lots of creatures, and with some support(like Dauthi Embrace) he can quickly kill players.

He's also a demon, and demons require some kind of sacrifice. His price is heavy, giving your opponent a 2 for 1 situation. Still, it's worth it.

posts.post_content:
This guy is awesome! Not only is he a 6/5 beast stick for 5 mana but his ability kills your opponent while giving you extra cards. If you're running him in a mono-black deck along with Life Gain Removal cards like Consume Spirit and Tendrils of Corruption, then he won't be a hassle at all. On the other hand if you have an Underworld Dreams or two in play, he's going to tear your opponent to pieces.  
  
All things considered, he's pretty damn good in a Mono Black deck...

posts.post_content:
This card is the predecessor of [Bloodgift Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodgift Demon), and both are very similar.  
  
This gets an additional +1/+1 but suffers without flying. Bloodgift only allows one draw per round of turns, but you choose who gets the card and the target loses 1 life.   
  
Personally, I'd say "F\*\*k it" and include both in a deck along side [Font of Mythos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Font of Mythos), [Graveborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Graveborn Muse), [Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine), [Underworld Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underworld Dreams) and obviously, [Phyrexian Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Arena)... and [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain), if you're feeling particularly evil and don't give a s\*\*t about rules.   
  
Yeah, screw you EDH. Whatever, Whatever, I'll do what i want!
posts.html:
